bibl.title: Letter, Ebenezer Hazard in Philadelphia, Pa. to Issac Hezelhurst.,1793 Oct. 26
bibl.note: Insurance Company of North America Records, 1792 December 1-1843 February 18

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I recd. your favr. of 24th. Inse. &forwarded it to MrNeuleitt,who desires me to inform you that the Risque on the Ship Brothers will be taken at 4 &Cy. but that not more than Ds. 2000 will be done on The Freight: There must be a warrantee that vessel &Goods are American Property, &that the Vessel does not carry two Setts of Papers. If these terms are agreeable, please inform me, & the Insurance shall be immediately effected.
In this Office Individuals do not write, but Mr. Nesbitt signs for the Company, so that you need be under no Apprehensions as to the Stability &Sufficiency of The Underwriters.
